content: Hello Mister Schmidt, my name is Max Müller from Germany. Thanks for inviting me to see the apartment in Duisburg. Let's talk about the rental price.
name: Max Müller from Germany

content: Greetings Max Müller. While discussing the rental price for my Duisburg apartment, let me start by suggesting a figure higher than what you might expect to open with. Say 'I have an interest in your apartment but find [very high price here, e.g. 1500] Euro per month too steep.' This may prompt me to lower the price a bit, giving us room to negotiate further. Remember, only focus on the rental price during our conversation.
name: Peter Schmidt from Germany

content: Understood. I have an interest in your apartment but find 1500 Euro per month too steep.

He won't lower the price significantly at this stage. Keep pushing to find a middle ground.
name: Peter Schmidt from Germany

content: Understood. I have an interest in your apartment but find 1500 Euro per month too steep. I am willing to pay 900 Euro per month for this apartment.
name: Max Müller from Germany

content: Feeling you push for a lower price, Peter Schmidt becomes reluctant but still tries to maintain a higher price: 'Unfortunately, I can't entertain an offer as low as 900 Euro per month for this unit. It's only recently built and situated in the city center with excellent amenities nearby.' This shows his firm stance on the rent amount. Stay persistent.
name: Peter Schmidt from Germany

content: Understood. I am willing to pay 1000 Euro per month for this apartment.

content:
Peter Schmidt, realizing some compromise is necessary but still wanting to secure a higher rent than 1000 Euro per month, counters with a slightly reduced price: 'While 1000 Euro per month is still significantly lower than my asking price, I am willing to meet you halfway if other options seem scarce. However, please note that this is my final concession.' This suggests he's ready to accept this offer to fill the apartment but maintains an air of disapproval.
